events.message: The customer reported an auto accident that occurred on April 30th involving their sedan and a delivery truck at a traffic intersection.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of the car collision in the claim submission.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this auto accident claim and will serve as the primary contact for the customer.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the customer received a confirmation email outlining the next steps in the auto accident claim process.
The agent requested supporting documents including photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and driver's statement to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed images of the damaged car and an official copy of the police collision report.
Investigation into the details of the accident has begun with an appointed claims investigator gathering all necessary information.
The investigation was completed, confirming the collision circumstances and liability from gathered evidence and witness statements.
A settlement offer has been proposed covering repair costs, rental car expenses, and other damages as per policy terms.
The customer provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the promptness and fairness of the proposed settlement for their auto accident claim.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager following the customer's acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment for the approved auto accident claim has been issued to the customer's registered bank account without delay.
The auto accident claim case has been closed after all payments were processed and the customer confirmed receipt.
The claim documents and case files for the auto accident were archived in compliance with company record-keeping policies for future reference.
